edu.uml.cs.isense.dfm
Class DataFieldManager

java.lang.Object
  Application
      edu.uml.cs.isense.dfm.DataFieldManager

public class DataFieldManager
extends Application

The DataFieldManager class is designed to, as its name implies, manage how data is associated with project fields on the iSENSE website. It provides field matching, organizing and formatting data sets, applying sensor compatibility checks, and writing data sets to a .csv file.

Field Detail

enabledFields

public boolean[] enabledFields
Boolean array of size 19 containing a list of fields enabled for recording data. See the Fields class for a list of the constants associated with this boolean array's respective indices. By default, each field is disabled. To enable a particular field for recording from your class, perform an operation such as: 
 myDFMInstance.enabledFields[Fields.ACCEL_X] = true;

Constructor Detail

DataFieldManager

public DataFieldManager(int projID,
                        API api,
                        Context mContext,
                        Fields f)
Constructor for the DataFieldManager class.

Parameters:
projID - - The ID of the project to be associated with this DataFieldManager, or -1 for no associated project.
api - - An instance of the API class.
mContext - - The context of the class containing the DataFieldManager object instance.
f - - An instance of the Fields class.
Method Detail

getOrder

public void getOrder()
Creates a list, stored in this DataFieldManager instance's "order" object, of matched fields from the iSENSE project with the instance's "projID". If no associated project is passed in (-1), the order array contains all possible fields to be recorded. Otherwise, the order array contains all fields that could be matched string-wise with the associated project's fields. NOTE: Ensure you call this method before recording data, or otherwise you will be given blank data back from the putData() method. Error checking may be added such as: 
 if (myDFMInstance.getOrderList().size() == 0) 
     myDFMInstance.getOrder();
to prevent such a bug from occurring. Additionally, if you intend on calling this function from within an AsyncTask, call getOrderWithExternalAsyncTask() instead.

getOrderWithExternalAsyncTask

public void getOrderWithExternalAsyncTask()
Use this function instead of getOrder() if and only if you are calling this function in an AsyncTask. See the getOrder() function for more details.

setOrder

public void setOrder(java.lang.String input)
Sets the DataFieldManager's order array based not on project field matching but rather the field's returned from from user field matching.

Parameters:
input - A field list built from the FieldMatching dialog.

putData

public JSONArray putData()
Creates a row of data from the Fields object this class instance contains. This function performs no field matching and assumes you are only calling it with the intention of saving it in the data saver.

Returns:
The row of data in the form of a JSONArray that is to be re-organized at upload time.

writeSdCardLine

public java.lang.String writeSdCardLine()
Writes a single line of data in .csv format. Data is pulled from this class instance's Fields object. NOTE: Only call this method if you are recording with an associated project. You will be returned a blank string otherwise. Also ensure that your .csv file begins with the String returned by writeHeaderLine().

Returns:
A single line of data in .csv format in the form of a String, or a blank string if there is no associated project.

writeHeaderLine

public java.lang.String writeHeaderLine()
Writes the first line in a .csv file for the project you are recording data for. Data can then by appended to this by calling writeSdCardLine(). NOTE: Only call this method if you are recording with an associated project. You will be returned a blank string otherwise.

Returns:
A single header line in .csv format in the form of a String, or a blank string if there is no associated project.

reOrderData

public static java.lang.String reOrderData(JSONArray data,
                                           java.lang.String projID,
                                           Context c,
                                           java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> fieldOrder,
                                           java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Long> fieldIDs)
Use this method only if data was recorded with no associated project AND you intend to create a QDataSet object with an associated project before adding the QDataSet to an UploadQueue object. This method will be called internally if you pass -1 as your project ID to the QDataSet object, and thus you do not need to call it.

Parameters:
data - - A JSONArray of JSONArray objects returned from the putData() method.
projID - - The project ID which the data will be re-ordered to match.
api - - An API class instance.
c - - The context of the Activity calling this function
fieldOrder - - The list of fields matched using the FieldMatching class, or null if FieldMatching wasn't used.
fieldIDs - - The list of field IDs, in order, of the project to reorder the data for (or null if you do not have them).
Returns:
A JSONObject.toString() formatted properly for upload to iSENSE.

setContext

public void setContext(Context c)
Set the context for this instance of DataFieldManager.

Parameters:
c - - The new context of this DataFieldManager instance.

writeProjectFields

public void writeProjectFields()
Writes the fields for the project out to SharedPreferences, designed to aid the writing of .csv files using getProjectFieldsAndSetCSVOrder when prepared to write a .csv file.

getProjectFieldsAndSetCSVOrder

public void getProjectFieldsAndSetCSVOrder()
Retrieve the fields written to SharedPreferences from writeProjectFields(), primarily designed for writing the header line in a .csv file.

getProjID

public int getProjID()
Getter for the project ID this DataFieldManager instance operates on.

Returns:
The current project ID.

setProjID

public void setProjID(int projectID)
Setter for the project ID this DataFieldManager instance operates on. NOTE: If you call this function, be sure you call getOrder() to update which fields this DataFieldManager instance records for.

Parameters:
projectID - - The new project ID for DataFieldManager to operate with.

getProjectFields

public java.util.ArrayList<RProjectField> getProjectFields()
Getter for the project fields associated with the project ID passed in to this instance of DataFieldManager.

Returns:
An ArrayList of RProjectField containing the fields from the associated iSENSE project.

Getter for the list of matched fields that this instance of DataFieldManager will record data for.

Returns:
The list of matched project fields from the associated project ID

convertInternalDataToJSONObject

public JSONArray convertInternalDataToJSONObject(JSONArray oldData)
Converts a JSONArray of JSONArray data into a JSONArray of JSONObject data where each JSONObject is the internal JSONArray element of the old data, keyed with the project's field IDs.

Parameters:
oldData - - JSONArray of JSONArray data to be converted
Returns:
A JSONArray of JSONObjects, ready for upload to the associated project.
